title: Rufford Abbey Country Park Walking Route

images.caption: The Lake

images.title: Tom Courtney / The front figure in "Mea Culpa"
images.caption: The front figure in "Mea Culpa" statue, the inners made from pieces of 'Dexion' perforated strip metal and the outer from thin galvanised steel sheet, pop riveted together. Artist....Robert Bryce Muir

images.title: Nigel Homer / Rufford Country Park
images.caption: Rufford Country Park. On the edge of historic Sherwood Forest, this 150 acre park is one of Nottinghamshires most popular visitor attractions. To the extreme right of this photo you can see the remains of a 12th century Cistercian monastery.

images.title: James Hill / Colourful island at Rufford Park
images.caption: Colourful island at Rufford Park. The beautiful reds and greens contrast well on the banks of the island in Rufford Lake.

images.title: PJMarriott, CC BY 3.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The gardens

description: Visit Rufford Country Park near Mansfield and explore 150 acres of historic parkland. In the park you will find a medieval monastery, a craft centre, formal gardens, woodland walks, a sculpture trail and a lake. Rufford park once formed part of a 12th century Cistercian abbey and its estate. It is now a country house estate surrounded by beautiful gardens and parkland open to the public. The Robin Hood Way Walk passes through the park so you can head north on to the nearby village of Edwinstowe, Sherwood Forest Country Park, Clumber Country Park and Thoresby Park if you have time. Just a couple of miles to the south east there's also Sherwood Pines Forest Park .

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: The on site Coach House cafe was the original Coach House forming part of the stables and outer courtyard complex. The building dates back to 1725 and now houses a lovely cafe where you can enjoy some post walk refreshments.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The woodland and parkland are ideal for dog walking so you'll probably see other owners on your visit. You are requested to keep them on leads.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Just to the east is the International Outdoor Adventure Activity Centre at Walesby Forest and the worthy village of Laxton. It's a historic place and significant as being England’s Last Open Field Village. You can visit the 12th century church, the Norman Motte and find out all about the area's history in the local visitor centre. For more walking ideas in the area see the Nottinghamshire Walks page.

display_address: May Lodge Drive, Rufford CP, Ollerton, Newark and Sherwood, Nottinghamshire, East Midlands, England, NG22 9DE, United Kingdom
